DataElement.preferredName: EORTC QLQ-PAN26 35 Extent During Past Week Find It Uncomfortable In Certain Positions Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated perception during the past week of the extent to which they find it uncomfortable in certain positions (e.g. lying down), using a four point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire - Pancreatic Cancer 26 Extent During Past Week Uncomfortable in Certain Positions Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London._A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 26 questions designed to assess pain, dietary changes, jaundice, altered bowel habit, emotional problems related to pancreatic cancer, and other symptoms (cachexia, indigestion, flatulence, dry mouth, taste changes)._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time._At some point in a given period of time._The most recent week, including today._A question about whether an individual is or was uncomfortable in certain positions._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer Quality of Life Questionnaire - Pancreatic Cancer 26
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.:A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 26 questions designed to assess pain, dietary changes, jaundice, altered bowel habit, emotional problems related to pancreatic cancer, and other symptoms (cachexia, indigestion, flatulence, dry mouth, taste changes).

Concepts.longName: European Organization for Research and Treatment of Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group with aims to conduct, develop, coordinate, and stimulate laboratory and clinical research in Europe to improve the management of cancer and related problems by increasing survival but also patients' quality of life. There are more than 60 institutions and departments that have been recognized by EORTC as affiliated. These groups conduct, on a voluntary basis, laboratory research and/or clinical trials on all types of cancers using a multidisciplinary approach. EORTC maintains close working relationship with NCI and the British Cancer Research United Kingdom in London.

Concepts.longName: Quality of Life Questionnaire - Pancreatic Cancer 26
Concepts.definition: A questionnaire developed by the European Organisation for Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) consisting of 26 questions designed to assess pain, dietary changes, jaundice, altered bowel habit, emotional problems related to pancreatic cancer, and other symptoms (cachexia, indigestion, flatulence, dry mouth, taste changes).

Property.preferredName: Extent During Past Week Uncomfortable in Certain Positions Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.:At some point in a given period of time.:The most recent week, including today.:A question about whether an individual is or was uncomfortable in certain positions.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.
At some point in a given period of time.
The most recent week. May include the present day.
A question about whether an individual is or was uncomfortable in certain positions.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (Not at All) to 4 (Very Much) on a Likert scale used on EORTC questionnaires.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of weak agreement.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer of no agreement or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer describing a fairly large amount or extent.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
